title: New OHADA regulation on commercial companies
excerpt: OHADA has adopted new provisions regarding the governance of commercial companies. Discover the major changes and their impact on your business.
content: The OHADA Council of Ministers adopted on January 10, 2024 a major revision of the Uniform Act relating to the law of commercial companies. These changes aim to modernize the legal framework for businesses and strengthen the protection of minority shareholders...
author: Barrister Jean-Paul Mbarga

title: Reform of the Cameroonian Labor Code: what's changing in 2024
excerpt: The Cameroonian government has announced several amendments to the Labor Code. Our detailed analysis of the new provisions for employers and employees.
content: The Ministry of Labor published decree no. 2024-001 amending several articles of the Labor Code. The main changes concern fixed-term contracts, dismissal procedures and parental leave...
author: Barrister Sophie Ekotto

title: Taxation 2024: new measures for companies
excerpt: The 2024 finance law introduces several important tax measures. Analysis of optimization opportunities and new reporting obligations.
content: The finance law for fiscal year 2024 was promulgated on December 31, 2023. It contains significant changes in corporate tax, VAT and local taxation. Companies must adapt their practices...
author: Barrister David Tchoumba

title: CEMAC Arbitration: new procedural rules
excerpt: The CEMAC Common Court of Justice and Arbitration has adopted new arbitration rules. Key points to know for your commercial disputes.
content: The new arbitration rules of the CCJA-CEMAC, effective January 1, 2024, modernize arbitration procedures in the CEMAC area. They notably introduce shorter deadlines and provisions on emergency arbitration...
author: Barrister Grace Njoya

title: Personal data protection: practical guide for companies
excerpt: With the entry into force of the personal data protection law, companies must comply. Our practical recommendations.
content: Law no. 2023-015 on the protection of personal data imposes new obligations on Cameroonian companies. Any organization processing personal data must now respect strict principles...
author: Barrister Jean-Paul Mbarga

title: Case law: major shift in civil liability
excerpt: The Supreme Court has just handed down an important decision modifying the assessment of civil liability in the event of bodily injury. Analysis and implications.
content: In its judgment of December 5, 2023, the Supreme Court of Cameroon made a shift in case law concerning the assessment of bodily injury. This decision will have significant consequences for all civil liability cases...
author: Barrister Aminata Ndiaye
